title: Variable atmosChem.mon.flashrate_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.flashrate)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "proposed name: lightning_flash_rate (units to be interpreted as 'counts km-2 s-1)";
Comment: Lightning Flash Rate
Long name: Lightning Flash Rate

title: Variable atmosChem.day.flashrate_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.flashrate)
Comment: Lightning Flash Rate
Long name: Lightning Flash Rate
Processing notes: frequency of lightning flashes per unit area

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.wetno3_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.wetno3)
Comment: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition
Long name: Wet deposition of nitrate aerosol

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.wethno3_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.wethno3)
Comment: This is the loss rate of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to wet deposition
Long name: wet deposition of HNO3

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropo3ste_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropo3ste)
Comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.
Long name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropdo3chm_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropdo3chm)
Comment: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropch4lossoh_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropch4lossoh)
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropch4loss_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropch4loss)
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.stratch4loss_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.stratch4loss)
Comment: This is the loss rate of stratospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause as used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the troposphere.
Long name: Loss of Stratospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rsuto3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rsuto3ref)
Comment: This is top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field
Long name: TOA shortwave flux assuming reference ozone field

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rsutcso3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rsutcso3ref)
Comment: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme
Long name: TOA shortwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rsutcsch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rsutcsch4ref)
Comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field
Long name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming clear-sky and reference methane field

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rsutch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rsutch4ref)
Comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field
Long name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming reference methane

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rluto3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rluto3ref)
Comment: This is outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
Long name: toa_outgoing_longwave_flux_assuming_reference_mole_fraction_of_ozone_in_air

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rlutcso3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rlutcso3ref)
Comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
Long name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone field

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rlutcsch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rlutcsch4ref)
Comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field
Long name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference methane field

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.rlutch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.rlutch4ref)
Comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference methane field
Long name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming reference methane field

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3ste_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.o3ste)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone. Set to ozone in the stratosphere, then destroyed in the troposphere using the ozone chemical loss rate. Please specify the tropopause definition used"; ; "modeling_realm" was "aerosol";
Comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.
Long name: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3inst_tpt-l-hxy-u (AERmon.o3inst)
Comment: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.
Long name: O3 volume mixing ratio
Processing notes: Note that this variable is an instantaneous field, sampled on the first day of each month, and not time-meaned over the month

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.meanage_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.meanage)
Comment: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.
Long name: Mean Age of Stratospheric Air

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.h2prod_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.h2prod)
Comment: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production
Long name: chemical production of atmospheric H2

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.h2loss_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.h2loss)
Comment: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction
Long name: Chemical destruction of atmospheric H2

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.h2_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.h2)
Comment: This is the mole fraction of molecular hydrogen (H2) in air
Long name: H2 volume mixing ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emilkch4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emilkch4)
Comment: This is the emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from freshwater lakes
Long name: lake emission rate of CH4

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emih2_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emih2)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) into the atmosphere (i.e., integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field)
Long name: Total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2)

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emich4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emich4)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of CH4

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emich3oh_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emich3oh)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of methanol (CH3OH) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of CH3OH

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic4h10_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic4h10)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of butane (C4H10) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C4H10

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic3h8_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic3h8)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of propane (C3H8) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C3H8

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic3h6_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic3h6)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C3H6

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic2h6_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic2h6)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C2H6

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic2h5oh_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic2h5oh)
Comment: This is the total emission rate of ethanol (C2H5OH) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C2H5OH

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emic2h4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emic2h4)
Comment: Total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere
Long name: total emission rate of C2H4

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emiavnox_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.emiavnox)
Comment: Emission rate of NOx from aircraft
Long name: Emission rate of NOx from aviation

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.emiach4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.emiach4)
Comment: Anthropogenic emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere
Long name: anthropogenic emission rate of CH4

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.e90inst_tpt-l-hxy-u (AERmon.e90inst)
Comment: Mole fraction of an artificial tracer with a 90-day lifetime (e90)
Long name: Artificial tracer with 90 day lifetime
Processing notes: Note that this variable is an instantaneous field, sampled on the first day of each month, and not time-meaned over the month

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.dryhno3_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.dryhno3)
Comment: This is the loss of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to dry deposition
Long name: Dry deposition of HNO3

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.dryh2_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.dryh2)
Comment: This is the total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via its soil sink due to bacterial consumption.
Long name: Total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via soil sink

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.do3chm_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.do3chm)
Comment: Net chemical production of ozone in the atmosphere
Long name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.dms_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.dms)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Long name: Dimethyl Sulphide (DMS) Mole Fraction

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.chepno3_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.chepno3)
Comment: Net chemical production rate of nitrate aerosol in the atmosphere
Long name: Net chemical production of nitrate aerosol

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.chepnh4_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.chepnh4)
Comment: Net chemical production rate of ammonium aerosol in the atmosphere.
Long name: Net chemical production of ammonium aerosol

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.chegph2oo1d_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.chegph2oo1d)
Comment: Primary production rate of the hydroxy (OH) radical via H2O+O1D
Long name: Primary production of OH (H2O+O1D)

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch4losssoil_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.ch4losssoil)
Comment: Loss rate of methane from the atmosphere due to soil sink
Long name: loss of methane from the atmosphere due to biological consumption in the soil

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch3oh_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.ch3oh)
Comment: Mole fraction of methanol (CH3OH) in air
Long name: CH3OH  volume mixing ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.c4h10_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.c4h10)
Comment: Mole fraction of butane (C4H10) in air
Long name: C4H10  volume mixing ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.c2h5oh_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.c2h5oh)
Comment: Mole fraction of ethanol (C2H5OH) in air
Long name: C2H5OH  volume mixing ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.c2h4_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.c2h4)
Comment: Mole fraction of ethene (C2H4) in air
Long name: C2H4  volume mixing ratio

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3ref_ti-l-hxy-u (AERfx.o3ref)
Comment: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.
Long name: Fixed Reference Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air
Processing notes: Use this when o3ref has no annual cycle.

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch4ref_ti-l-hxy-u (AERfx.ch4ref)
Comment: This is the methane mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when a methane double call is active in the model.
Long name: Reference mole fraction of methane in air

title: Variable atmosChem.day.wetnoy_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.wetnoy)
Comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy

title: Variable atmosChem.day.wetnh4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.wetnh4)
Comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4

title: Variable atmosChem.day.wetnh3_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.wetnh3)
Comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3

title: Variable atmosChem.day.drynoy_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.drynoy)
Comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy

title: Variable atmosChem.day.drynh4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.drynh4)
Comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH4 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH4

title: Variable atmosChem.day.drynh3_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERday.drynh3)
Comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
Long name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3Clim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Long name: Mole Fraction of O3
Processing notes: If O3 does not vary from one year to the next, report 12 months, starting with January.   (Note: include all 12 months even if the values do not vary seasonally.)  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as tro3Clim, not tro3. If the O3 varies from one year to the next,  then report instead the field described in the previous table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Long name: Mole Fraction of O3
Processing notes: If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobalClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1.00E-09 CMIP7:mol mol-1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobal)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Comment: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.n2oClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Long name: Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as n2oglobal, not n2o.   If  N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.n2o)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Long name: Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.hcfc22global)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-12"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - primary - CMIP6:atmos, atmosChem CMIP7:atmosChem, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch4_tclm-u-hm-u (Amon.ch4globalClim)

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.ch4_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.ch4Clim)
